hypothesis_content.title: Meme Coin (DOGE/PEPE) 1-Hour Extreme Deviation Reversion in Bull/Neutral Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL or NEUTRAL regimes, when a meme coin (DOGE or PEPE) experiences a 1-hour price pump > 15% on volume > 500% of its 20-hour average, a short entry at the close of that hour will be profitable as price mean-reverts over the next 6 hours, provided the move is not confirmed by a similar surge in BTC.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Meme coins are prone to retail-fueled, unsustainable pumps on low liquidity. A massive, isolated hourly spike on anomalous volume often exhausts short-term buyers. Fading such moves in a non-bearish broader regime capitalizes on rapid profit-taking and lack of follow-through.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour return < 50% of the altcoin's return (decoupling filter)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 1-hour spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new high above the spike candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of trades are stopped out before hitting the 50% retracement target, or average PnL is negative.
